result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher James Gouge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Christopher J. Gouge in court with attorney James McLaughlin.  Defendant Christopher J. Gouge in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendation joint.  Atty McL makes arguement.

Court:  14 CM 312:   6 months county jail Concurrent to 12 CF 172  /  court obligations as previously ordered are converted to civil judgment                                                 
15 CM 279:      9 months county jail            Credit 57 days time served           Concurrent to 12 CF 172, 14 CM 351 and 14 CM 312 /   court obligations as previously ordered are converted to civil judgment

14 CM 351:           9 months county jail                                                       
  Concurrent to 12 CF 172, 14 CM 312     / court obligations as previously ordered are converted to civil judgment
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 31, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 29, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Christopher James Gouge in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 CM 312, 14 CM 351 and 15 cm 282.  9:43 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  State recites plea agreement:
14 CM 312 - NC - and 14 CM 351 and 15 CM 279 and(15CM 282 DRI) - probation 18 months - 60 days county jail concurrent - absolute sobriety - costs 19 days credit as of today.  Atty Schlough agrees as does the defendant.   Court questions defendant as to plea questionnaire.  Plea of NC to counts 14 CM 312, 14 CM 351 and 15 CM 279.  Court finds defendant guilty 14 CM 312, 14 CM 351 and 15 CM 279.  15 CM 282 is dismissed and read in.  State argues sentencing.  Atty Schlough argues sentencing.  Defendant addressed the Court.

COURT:14 CM 312:  Sentence w/held probation 18 months  any probation now serving- 60 days county jail with credit for 19 days time served to report to jail on/before 11/27/15 by 3:00 pm - absolute sobriety - costs - counselling as may be recommended and restitution in requested

14 CM 351:  Sentence w/held probation 18 months concurrent to 14 CM 312 and any other probation - 60 days county jail concurrent to 14 CM 312 - absolute sobriety - costs - counseling as may be recommended

15 CM 279:  Sentence w/held probation 18 months concurrent to 14 CM 312 and 14 CM 351 and any other probation- 60 days county jail concurrent to 14 CM 312 and 351 - absolute sobriety and costs - DNA surcharge and submit sample - counseling as may be recommended

Defendant Christopher J. Gouge in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough via phone.  Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 15 CM 279, 15 CM 282 and 14 CM 351.  Atty Schlough addressed the Court never rec'd notice of hearing.  Atty Marcoux makes stmt.  Bond reinstated and warrant quashed.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Christopher James Gouge not in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough. Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 15 CM 312, 15 CM 279 and 14 CM 251.  10:10 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  State requests warrant and bail forfeiture hearing.  Court ordered warrants on all files and bail forfeiture proceedings to begin.  Signature bonds are vacated and enter assessment.
